of the Justia client newsletter!

Tip of the Month

Get Found on the Justia Lawyer Directory

People searching for a lawyer on the Justia Lawyer Directory may filter their search results based on a number of parameters to find a lawyer who best fits their needs. If you don't yet have a Justia Lawyer Rating, you risk getting filtered out by users looking only for highly ranked lawyers. Don't get lost in the shuffle; ask colleagues familiar with your work to write you a review! Once you have peer reviews, you will receive a Justia rating badge on your profile that you can proudly display on your website, blog or other marketing materials.
Learn More

Tech News

EU’s New Digital Strategy Targets Data-Hoarding Tech Firms

Building on the regulations implemented under the GDPR in 2018, the EU seeks to further rein in data access and usage by tech giants, especially Facebook and Google.

The US is Charging Huawei With Racketeering

US officials have brought 16 charges against Huawei and related defendants, including conspiracy to violate the RICO Act, lying to federal investigators, and obstruction.

Featured Site of the Month

Klemick & Gampel, P.A.

in Miami, FL, recently launched 
their Justia website:

klemickandgampel.com

SEO News

Google Backtracks on Using (Relevant) Keywords in Your Google My Business Description

Google issued and quickly rescinded guidance suggesting that local business owners incorporate relevant keywords in GMB descriptions after pushback from local SEO experts.

Google on Dealing With Manual Actions & Reconsideration Requests

If your site has received a penalty and you’re unable to resolve the issue via reconsideration request, Google advises asking for input in the Google Webmasters Help forum.

Google Search Console Adds Review Snippets Performance, Enhancement and Testing Reports

For sites with reviews on their pages, Google is now offering additional support in the form of various reports that can help webmasters understand how these pages are performing.

Google’s Mobile-First Indexing: Everything We Know (So Far)

This compilation of pointers on mobile-first indexing seeks to clarify certain aspects of the rollout, and also includes explanations of how it may impact specific categories of sites.

Internet Stats

Digital Ad Market Share (2019)

Source: eMarketer

Google and Facebook account for roughly 60% of the total digital ad market, with Amazon gaining speed. Digital ad spending in the U.S. will now exceed traditional media spending, e.g. TV, print and radio ads for the first time.

Jeremy Saland of Crotty | Saland PC was quoted by Fox Business regarding the Harvey Weinstein conviction

Did You Know?

We Hosted Our “Just Meet Up!” Event

We held our first "Just meet up!" event for this year, a bimonthly event where students get together with our engineers to learn about various topics in technology from programming to SEO. Mayra, our Director of Engineering, spoke about Machine Learning and the students took advantage of the opportunity to exchange ideas with our group of experienced engineers.

Social Media News

YouTube Is Testing a New Way for Creators to Make Money from Viewers

YouTube creators may soon be able to access a new means of raising funds directly from viewers with a feature that allows viewers to purchase “applause” on any video at any time.

New Instagram Feature Helps Users Clean Up Their Following List

Instagram is rolling out a new feature that allows users to refine their feeds by grouping accounts they are following into categories such as seen most often or least interacted with.

Twitter Will Ban ‘Deceptive’ Faked Media That Could Cause ‘Serious Harm’

Twitter is banning fake pictures, video, and other potentially harmful content, and will also start labeling and giving more context to media that has been significantly “manipulated.”

YouTube Is the Frontrunner in the Mobile Streaming Wars, and It’s Not Even Close

New research shows that YouTube accounts for 70 percent of the total time users spend viewing content on their phones in the top five entertainment apps, which include Netflix.

A Pug’s Tale

Sheba’s Sweet Sixteen

Sheba, our original Hug Pug, celebrated her sweet 16th birthday this February! She enjoyed a special birthday cake and got lots of attention.

Legal Industry News

Law Schools See an Increase in Bar Passage Rates, New ABA Data Shows

New data shows that 2019 first-time bar exam takers had a bar passage rate that was nearly 5 percentage points higher than for those who took the bar exam for the first time in 2018.

Ransomware Attacks Hit Three Law Firms in Last 24 Hours

At least five law firms, including three in a 24-hour period, have been targeted by hackers with ransomware attacks that are typically initiated with emails containing malicious attachments.
